intro: Urostigma populneum, commonly known as the common thornapple, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the nightshade family (Solanaceae) and is characterized by its spiny stems and lobed leaves. The plant produces showy, violet-blue flowers that bloom in the summer months. Its fruit is a capsule that contains numerous small, hard seeds. Urostigma populneum is often found in disturbed soils and can be invasive in certain areas.
